text: Shadoe Stevens (born November 3, 1947) is an American radio host, television personality and voiceover actor. He hosted the American Top 40 from August 1988 to January 1995. On television, Stevens was the announcer for The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson. Stevens first became famous in 1957 when a Life magazine article titled "America's Youngest D.J." ran a story on him.
